organic_results.title: Effect of the global system on language instruction, 1850-1986
organic_results.snippet: This article examines how the structural changes in the international system during the past 11/2 centuries affected the rise and decline of language subjects in the school curriculum. An extensive data analysis shows the rapid decline of classical languages and the concomitant increase in national curricular emphasis devoted to national languages and modern foreign languages. The structural transformation and hierarchical rearrangement of hegemonic powers in the international system also had a strong impact on the types of …
